text: In Greek mythology, Argiope (Ancient Greek: Αργιόπη "silver face") may refer to: * Argiope, naiad daughter of the River God Nile.Gantz, p. 208; Pherecydes fr. 21 Fowler 2001, p. 289 = FGrHist 3 F 21 = Scholia on Apollonius Rhodius, Argonautica 3.1177-87f. She was wife of Agenor and mother of Europa,Hyginus, Fabulae 178 Cadmus,Hyginus, Fabulae 6 Phoenix and Cilix. More commonly known as Telephassa. * Argiope, naiad, possibly the daughter of the river-god Cephissus, mother of Thamyris by Philammon.Pseudo-Apollodorus. Bibliotheca 1.3.3 She lived at first on Mount Parnassus but when Philammon refused to take her into his house as his wife, she left Parnassus and went to the country of the Odrysians in Thrace when pregnant.Pausanias, Graeciae Descriptio 4.33.3 * Argiope, naiad of the town of Eleusis, mother of Cercyon by Branchus.Pseudo- Apollodorus, Epitome 1.3 Possibly same as the above Argiope thus, a daughter of the river-god Cephissus. * Argiope, daughter of Teuthras, king of Teuthrania, a region near Mysia in Asia Minor. She married Telephus, son of Heracles.Diodorus Siculus, Bibliotheca historica 4.33 Not to be confused with Agriope (Ἀγριόπην) *Agriope, another name for Eurydice, wife of Orpheus whom the hero unsuccessfully brought back from Hades.Athenaeus, Deipnosophistae 13.71 == Notes == == References == * Diodorus Siculus, The Library of History translated by Charles Henry Oldfather.
